title: [Bug]: lost ability to have multiple instances running with --customUserDir option
body:
### Can you reproduce this bug in the website/PWA?

Yes

### Describe the bug

I have been running with a couple of instances of t4l and gave it two separate userdirs per the --customUserDir=/path/to/customdir but now it's not working. It won't allow two concurrent t4l to run. It just is ignores

### What package are you using?

deb

### Version

2.0.5 

### Reproduction steps

```markdown
1.Launch first instance via launcher /usr/bin/teams-for-linux --customUserDir=/home/me/t4luserdir1 --appTitle=Instance1
2. Application starts, all good. 
3. Launch a second instance as I have for many months now via launcher /usr/bin/teams-for-linux --customUserDir=/home/me/t4luserdir2 --appTitle=Instance2
4. Nothing happens. Instance1 is fine. 
5. Running for direct command line as non-root and no errors there. 




...
```

### Expected Behavior

```markdown
1. Launch first instance via launcher /usr/bin/teams-for-linux --customUserDir=/home/me/t4luserdir1 --appTitle=Instance1
2.Application starts - all good and accessing Teams on that specific login
3. Launch a second instance as I have for many months now via launcher /usr/bin/teams-for-linux --customUserDir=/home/me/t4luserdir2 --appTitle=Instance2
4. Additional instance of team-for-linux starts and uses the different userdir (with a different login)
...
```

### Debug

```markdown
This is when trying to start the second instance with the second userdir.

$ /usr/bin/teams-for-linux --customUserDir=/home/me/t4l/<dir2> --appTitle=Name2 --webDebug~
No config file found, using default values
all good with customUserDir you aren't using them
all good with clearStorage you aren't using them
Initialising logger with config: {"transports":{"console":{"level":"debug"},"file":{"level":false}}}
16:23:28.709 › Console logging enabled with level debug
16:23:28.711 › Logger initialised
16:23:28.711 › configPath: /home/me/.config/teams-for-linux
16:23:28.711 › configFile: {}
16:23:28.826 › App already running
16:23:28.828 › (node:1000552) [DEP0180] DeprecationWarning: fs.Stats constructor is deprecated.
(Use `teams-for-linux --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)
 
and it does nothing.
```

### Additional context

First one, no matter which one I try will start if there is not an instance running, but a second instance now seems impossible to do all of a sudden...
